abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Lake Titicaca Local
            Sustainable Development Project for Bolivia were as follows:
            outcomes was unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was unsatisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: Respecting existing institutional
            mandates and avoiding project-specific institutional roles
            and coordination mechanisms. Taking early action on
            fundamental restructurings. Implementation Support in Low
            Capacity Environments. Adopting appraisal stage readiness
            criteria for subprojects. Incorporating contingency planning
            to manage investment uncertainty. Taking into account
            contracting risks in design. Following up participatory
            planning with continued communication.
